content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Smelting Facility at Position (6.0, -62.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone Furnace at position (6.0, -62.0) with coal as fuel. The furnace is currently processing iron ore and producing iron plates. The furnace has been restocked with 20 units of coal and is in a working state.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when placing entities without having them in inventory
- Ensure that the entity you are trying to place is available in your inventory. For example, attempting to place a stone furnace at position (-10.0, -50.0) failed because there was no stone furnace in the inventory.

### Errors due to insufficient crafting materials
- Verify that you have all the necessary materials before attempting to craft an item. For instance, crafting a stone furnace requires 5 stones, but the agent had 0 stones available, leading to a crafting failure.

### Errors when inserting items without having them in inventory
- Ensure that you have the required items in your inventory before attempting to insert them into an entity. For example, attempting to insert coal into a furnace failed because there was no coal in the inventory at that time.

### Errors due to insufficient extraction of items
- Ensure that the required number of items are available for extraction. For example, an assertion error occurred because the agent attempted to extract 10 iron plates but only 9 were available. Always check the available quantity before extraction to avoid such errors.

### Errors when using incorrect argument types
- Ensure that you are passing the correct argument types to functions. In step 12, an error occurred because a position was passed instead of an Entity or EntityGroup. Always check the function documentation to confirm the expected argument types.

### Errors due to furnace not working after restocking
- Ensure that the furnace has all necessary ingredients and conditions to start working after restocking. In step 14, the agent restocked the furnace with coal, but it did not start working because there were no ingredients to smelt. Always verify that the furnace has both fuel and ingredients.

### Errors due to missing iron ore in inventory
- Ensure that you have iron ore in your inventory before attempting to insert it into the furnace. In step 20, an error occurred because there was no iron ore in the inventory to insert into the furnace. Always check your inventory for the required materials before attempting to insert them into a furnace.

### Errors due to incorrect inventory assertion
- Ensure that the inventory assertion checks are correctly implemented. In step 19, an assertion error occurred because the check for iron ore in the furnace inventory was incorrect. Always verify that the logic for inventory assertions aligns with the actual inventory state to prevent such errors.

### Errors due to missing items for assembling machine
- Ensure that all required items are available in the inventory before attempting to craft or assemble. In step 23, an error was noted due to missing iron plates and electronic circuits needed for an assembling machine. Always check the inventory for necessary components before starting an assembly process.
